bibl.title: The Reception of Sappho's Brothers Poem in Rome.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738). - Echoes of the Brothers Song can be found in Ovid's Heroides 15 (Epistula Sapphus) and Horace's Odes 1.9; 3.29. Like Sappho's poem, the latter promotes an ethos disparaging trade in favour of philosophical detachment with more than a hint of aristocratic anti-mercantile prejudice.
